Round Ledger Amounts allows for automatically balancing rounding differences for the ledger amounts for a multi-currency Journal Entry as long as the following criteria are met:*All Line Company References must match the Company Reference for the Accounting Journal*Ledger Debit and Ledger Credit amounts are blank or zero*All journal lines use the same currency rate*All journal lines use the same transaction currency*A Balancing Worktag Reference is not specified for the Recurring Journal Template

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: The company for the line for intercompany journals.If field is left blank, it will default to the same company as the header company. For non-intercompany journals this field should be left blank or have the same value as the header company.  For beginning balance journal loads, this field should always be blank or the same as the header company. For journals that are intercompany beginning balances, the other company should only be referenced as an intercompany affiliate worktag.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: Alternate Ledger Account (ALA) provides the ability, when Alternate Account Set is enabled for the header company,  to override the account to which the Ledger Account is mapped by the Alternate Account Set Mapping rules.I.E. - if the Ledger Account is 1000 Cash, and the mapping rules map the journal to the 1100 Alternate Cash account, setting the ALA to 1200: Other Cash Account will cause the journal to use Other Cash rather than Alternate Cash.

validation.validation: The Currency Rate cannot be negative.

validation.validation: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.
validation.description: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.

validation.description: The Debit Amount precision cannot exceed the precision of the Company currency.

validation.validation: If the base currency is not equal to the transaction currency, the ledger amount must also be entered.
validation.description: If the base currency is not equal to the transaction currency, the ledger amount must also be entered.

validation.validation: Ledger Debit Amount must be blank or zero when Round Ledger Amounts is specified.
validation.description: Ledger Debit Amount must be blank or zero when Round Ledger Amounts is specified.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: For expense report and supplier invoice transactions tied to a capital project worktag, Workday creates special accounting to appropriately debit the Work in Progress account, while also recording the amount as a debit into the Spend account.  This is necessary to reflect correct amounts for the purposes of Budget Checking/Reporting, and any other custom spend reports.
